website_summaries.verdict: Almost all dog breeds bark instinctively, but this training collar is designed to correct excessive or inappropriate barking.
pros: Uses warning beeps and a gradual progression of shock levels
Allows dogs to bark when appropriate
cons: Shock mode may hurt smaller breeds
Some dogs continue to bark without correction

customer_reviews.title: Stops working
customer_reviews.text: I got this product 2 years ago for my lab since we have a cabin and he is constantly in and out of the water. Plus there are no fences so we needed to have some control. This product worked wonderful and I loved it but after about a year and half it stopped working consistently and would only work about 10 feet away. It needs to be charged constantly and when you can’t count on the collar to work it’s useless. I thought after spending $140 for the product it should have worked longer. Don’t recommend unless your willing to purchase a new every year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Cierra Gatena

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: 3rd update 12/15/2018 Google this product. It's discontinued for good reason. 2nd update: I've had 3 units in 4 months and none worked properly. The replacement is officially dead exactly ONE day after the return period. The odds of this being a decent product is NONE. 1st update: This is a mess. The replacement is bumming out after a few days. Unacceptable. Much too expensive for continuing issues. Works sometimes. The buttons don't match the actions.... The beep button will shock and the shock button beeps.... when it works. I'll keep returning until I get a unit that actually works like it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: JudgeJudyFan

customer_reviews.title: Great item...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a wonderer and does not like to be contained. When I am outside with her, I put this collar on her. This shock collar has a beep option on it. This option is typically all it takes to get my dogs attention. Occasionally I will have to use the low shock option, this is typically for her own safety when she wants to wonder across the road. The range on this unit is fantastic, and I have not had any of the issues I read about on the other reviews. I’m glad those reviews didn’t keep me from trying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! UNSAFE! Randomly stops receiving signal from remote.
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for about 4 months then started having problems at random times. It happened first end of Feb and has been happening more and more often. Past three times I've taken my dog out it just didn't work when I needed it to and won't no matter what. Seems to be in a habit of working fine when I turn it on but by the time i'm out it has stopped and wont work again until I leave it overnight. Totally unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Stash67

customer_reviews.title: Worse Than Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Only worked intermittently. When it did work, it sent a shock so strong my Labrador went strait into the air with a yelp...even on a setting as low as 4. Levels 1-3 were completely flat. I tried it on my finger to ensure it wasn’t just my dog’s thick hair getting in the way. I felt nothing for several clicks and then received a shock so strong I threw the collar down. Definitely NOT safe for your dog. This collar is the opposite of training as there is NO way to determine when and how much it will work. Your poor dog will be confused and terrified.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: A different dog with this on!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this months ago and didn't really use it much because my dog would never do anything naughty the minute I put it on. I decided to bring it to the cabin but had planned on having him tied up or on a leash the entire time. As it turns out, he was perfect with this collar on and didn't need to be leashed. I don't have to shock him but instead use the tones to let him know when he gets too far away or does something wrong and he comes running back to me as soon as I do. I am very thankful for the freedom this product has given my dog and I!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... doggie equivalent of ADD) that I was having a terrible time training
customer_reviews.text: I have a VERY high energy Belgian Shepherd (that I think has the doggie equivalent of ADD) that I was having a terrible time training. He learned everything quickly, but wouldn't keep a sit for more than 2 seconds, forget about the stay! With my remote trainer, I only had to give a "tone reminder" after a few weeks. I started giving a verbal correction with the tone and now, we are collar free and he behaves beautifully! This was probably the best investment I could have ever made for him! SO glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.author: bob key

customer_reviews.title: Good idea when it works
customer_reviews.text: Collars on two dogs will work 1 time and shut down. Seems all units are constantly in need of charging. Have had some success breaking dogs from chasing cars, but could be much farther along if there wasn't always some part of system not working. Units are difficult to program, and instructions for doing so are poorly written. Wish I had purchased a cheaper unit, as I can't believe they would be worse than these are. I do not recommend this system.
customer_reviews.author: Patty S.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd one. 1st one in less than a year stopped working. Amazon was great and replaced it, however received Aug and today Dec 12th same issue no longer working. Collar and handheld turn on, but the collar does work (beep or shock). I would not recommend PetSafe Yard brand.
customer_reviews.author: SKK

customer_reviews.title: Finally got my dog to stop barking for 10 minutes straight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not expecting to much and was shockingly surprised(no pun intended). It works very well! It took about a month for my dog to completely stop barking for 10 minutes straight. He still barks but not near as often as he used to. I usually let him bark twice then use the beeping sound and he quits now. The first couple weeks I did have to use the shock setting but he learned to be a better dog for the neighborhood from it. The battery usually last 2 days for me after I let it charge at night. Good buy if you have a German Shepherd or bigger dog.
customer_reviews.author: lucas montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 90 days than broke..
customer_reviews.text: Purchased collar 3 months ago. Everything was working absolutely great up until now. The shock has completely stopped working. Now all this collar is good for is the beep tones. Very displeased with this item. When I spend 125$ on something I expect it to work longer than 3 months...
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT shock collar at a GREAT price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this shock collar as a back-up, because we have been using the exact same model for 2+ years, and it is still going strong - the rechargeable battery is still holding a charge. This mode is the best collar we have used, and we have purchased/used MANY collars for our 3 dogs over the last 20+ years. (Looks like you might be out of luck, I can't find the collar on Amazon - the $77.00 price might have been a close-out offer). But this collar if you can find it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: What a great dog. But somewhere along the line he got ...
customer_reviews.text: After watching the Dog Whisperer and a bunch of dog training how-to-videos together, my truly-gifted ten-year-old dog and I have made tremendous progress in the manners department. What a great dog. But somewhere along the line he got the idea that anything outside of the fence is a threat (he alerted me to a sneaky robber when he was only three-months old). Great watchdog but a little bit over zealous. One day with this tool and he is able to dial it down to a woof woof all the way from his former go-ballistic approach. Great dog. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Finicky Fred

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted three months.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our dog because we live out in the country with no fence. We don't like to shock him and only very rarely used it. When he ran off after a deer tonight, we tried to use it and it didn't seem to bother him at all. We tested it out once we got him home and it has stopped working. It was delivered to us on November 13 and today is February 20. Because we almost never had to use it, I don't know exactly when it stopped working, but I am not impressed that it doesn't work after 3 months. It was never submerged and was only lightly used.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Moore

customer_reviews.title: I tried leashes, choke chains, a harness. ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried leashes, choke chains, a harness. Nothing to get my 55lb female pit lab mix to not pull a leap. Not only that, she wants to stop and sniff something every 100ft, and I'd have to stop, too. :). After training her with the Petsafe collar, we just took our first 2-mile walk with no leash. It was heavenly. She responds to voice and tones, even sitting/staying for incoming cars. She typically walked about 20-30 ft in front of me, turning her head occasionally to see where I was. I'm actually looking forward to our walk tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Love the portability of the product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace sane product that battery ran its course. I like this product because you can take it anywhere and use it. It is a rechargeable battery for the collar and remote. This is our third one of the same item - we get about 1-1 1/2 yrs out of it. For the price i think that is a good deal. We use it everyday so it gets a lot of use. The collar is a little bulky but this item is a lot less expensive than other similar items. It doesn't seem to bother my dog when he is wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Lora B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent aid to make my dog "listen"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent aid to make my dog "listen". He is very dominant and has the bad habit to jump on people and charge on other dogs. He's also super fast so anytime I tried to correct him at the park, he ran away and I couldn't never chase him. This shock collar took care of it. We tried it yesterday at the park and it worked great. I can just follow behind him and correct him as soon as I see him attempting to do a bad habit. He didn't jump on anyone, instead he sat next to the person and wait to receive affection. It also got him off other dogs, while being playful. Make sure is fully charged though.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Alonso

customer_reviews.title: This remote training collar was great until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This remote training collar was great until it stopped working. I had the collar for about two months and used it everyday until the collar no longer received signals from the remote. I read the manual and attempted several different methods to bring this device back to life but was unsuccessful. I saw other reviews mentioning the same issue I had, unfortunately, after my device stopped working. If the collar was still working, I would give it five stars. It has excellent range and wonderful adjustable settings. I have since purchased a Sportdog collar from Gander Mountain with insurance.
customer_reviews.author: Hale

customer_reviews.title: While the operational elements of this collar are good: buttons
customer_reviews.text: While the operational elements of this collar are good: buttons, settings, operation. The battery is abysmal. A huge disappointment. Particularly the battery in the collar, which now takes 2 days to recharge and only lasts a short time. Initially, I charged the battery as prescribed. This device has not been wet or in a difficult environment, so dismiss environmental factors. If they fix the battery problem, then this would be worth the $60 or so I paid for it. I have not tried other devices and this is my first training collar. Heavier users of these devices may have more helpful comments.
customer_reviews.author: Highmom

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it simply stops working
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this collar with my dog when we're hiking so I can keep him from running off after animals but still allow him to run around. This is the second collar I've purchased from PetSafe, the first having stopped working after 2 years. The new collar worked well for about 5 months then died. PetSafe sent a replacement (several weeks after I notified them of the problem) which didn't work at all. It's a great idea for a product but they seem to have quality issues which will prevent me from buying any products from them in the future, especially since it takes so long to get help and replacements from them.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This product is really well put together as well as the customer service behind it. We had a battery go bad after about 1.5 months, emailed them the Amazon invoice, and they sent a replacement battery. That seems like a pretty normal way to operate quality customer service, but they went far beyond that. The battery came with a new gasket, a screwdriver, and the best instruction manual I've ever seen. I was blown away and the thought and care they put into the product and customer service. After opening the case up, I also saw how well designed the product was.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product ,a no brainer
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance , peace of mind security knowing that this product does a fine job. Its range is 10/10 Audible beep for dog 8/10 Audible beep for me 0 /10 Shock control 10/10 Charging and collar construction 10 /10 Spend the money you get what you pay for . I'm very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: HA Shevak

customer_reviews.title: We 7 acres and this is perfect for keeping control
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this item twice. Yes, it's expensive - but it's worth it - especially if you are really training dogs. We 7 acres and this is perfect for keeping control, training, and "reminding" - as you can simply press the "beep" function. I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Good training tool for dogs at a reasonable cost. Easy to operate with some good features (beep only, shock, different shock levels). The battery life isn't the longest but it's rechargeable so not that big of a deal. Just plug it in every night and you're good to go for the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Big Worm

customer_reviews.title: Good remote trainer witha horrible collar
customer_reviews.text: The collar included with this product is horrible. It's a very stiff vinyl product that never un-stiffens. It may make a great horse collar but with all the synthetic material options available, it's a poor choice. I have other PetSafe products that utilize nicer materials. Remote and sensor work well. We use the tone feature to easily correct our dog. Need to now find a replacement band for the neck sensor. Look closely at the product photo before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not for giant, hairy dogs
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all for my giant dog (200 pound Caucasian Shepherd - super hairy). It did work on my 24-year-old brother, though, so I’m sure it would work well on smaller dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Kynzi Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great in theory
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great in theory. How ever for the price I expected the devise to work for more than 90 day. With that said it no longer works , making me wonder if I should have just spent the money on dog training. When I tried to return the devise Amazon told me that I was 4 days past return date. GO FIGURE SAVE YOUR MONEY & SANITY
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Garant

customer_reviews.title: Best $ spent.
customer_reviews.text: Only used this for 2 days so far. I have a lab that's only 6 months old. Great dog but when you take him outside, he just didn't want to listen to any commands. We use the sound that beeps and tell him "no". If he didn't listen, he got the shock wave on level 5. (8 is highest). He got shocked 3 times yesterday. Today he is listening to just the beep without any shock wave. Great product. I wish I had this years ago for all of my other dogs. It would if saved everyone a lot of stress. I would definitely recommend this product and would definitely buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Santoyo

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR SMALL DOGS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our Frenchton (French bulldog/Boston terrier) who is about 15 lbs to train her to stay in her yard and not go to the bathroom in the house. It worked great but, this is not meant for small dogs. The box is so heavy that the prongs literately cut her skin! She hasn't been able to wear any collar and has horrible scabs that need tended to twice a day. I am sure this would work great on a larger dog but, not on a dog 8 lbs and up as the description says.
customer_reviews.author: Hollz13

customer_reviews.title: I did not think there was any hope for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not think there was any hope for my Husky actually following commands. She is perhaps the strongest willed dog I've ever had. We only had to use the 'shock' 2 times at a fairly low setting (3) to teach her to come when called. (She prefers to run wild) Silly dog has no idea that her collar is not even turned on half the time that she wears it now.
customer_reviews.author: LaVonne Pinkston

customer_reviews.title: These training collars REALLY WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought some cheaper training collars but found that that brand went to sleep and did not always 'wake up' like they were advertised. Talked to the PetSafe people before purchase - very polite and knowledgeable folks. The PetSafe collars do not go to sleep - they stay active and have saved the lives of my guinea fowl and chickens. These collars have kept my puppies safe and within their boundaries. Usually I only need to use the audible beep. These are VERY EFFECTIVE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul and Sally Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Won’t charge!
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I first bought it a couple times for a few minutes each then didn’t use it for several months; tried to charge it yesterday and collar won’t charge. Very expensive item for the little bit of use I received
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Bentz

customer_reviews.title: " It has worked beautifully for helping me train a rescue with behavioral issues
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned that this would be too harsh, but it has adjustable settings, including one that is just a "beep." It has worked beautifully for helping me train a rescue with behavioral issues. Although she has thick hair it still works well. Also, I have only had to use a low setting and, after just a couple of times using it, now just wearing it has the same effect.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Fly

customer_reviews.title: Totally works and quick results!
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver for our 120 Great Pyrenees. Even though we took him to obedience class and he was great in the leash, out puppy regularly jumped the fence, leaped over gates and took off thru the country roads. He wanted to play with all kinds of neighbor hood dogs who were more interested in fighting than playing. We bought this as a last hope to training and keeping. Immediately worked. Only a few shocks and he is obedient to our commands to halt and come. This literally saved his life and now we can trust him off leash. Cannot day enough good. And it’s waterproof which is what we needed on the farm.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Willis

customer_reviews.title: Winner winner
customer_reviews.text: This trainer is awesome. We had purchased a different model of this brand from a pet store and were disappointed with it's durability and the frequency we had to replace batteries. This model was much better. Just plug it in at night and it's ready to go by morning. The only thing we didn't like was the collar. We bought a collar that clips together rather than having to put it through a buckle every time.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Works great on long haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a full blood AKC German shepherd service dog. I’ve been homeless for a hot minute and she got a little undisciplined. Within a week of owning this I got my girl back on the right track without having to shave her neck. It’s actually a static collar. Not true shock nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Zarathustra Sez

customer_reviews.title: My big guy developed a bad infection-our own fault for not following instructions
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT LEAVE ON YOUR PET!!! The instructions state not to leave it on for more than 12hrs at a time. My big guy developed a bad infection-our own fault for not following instructions. The product itself is alright. I have a Great Pyrenees and the shock on low settings didn't seem to have much of an effect on his behavior (trying to run off). It didn't touch his skin through his thick, long hair, and there were no longer prongs included :/
customer_reviews.author: Cersei L.

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is almost five years old now, and still works great. Have used it on two dogs in their teenage years, and only occasionally ever pull it out anymore. We taught them the “positive” sound and the “negative” sound. On our long coat lab mix, I only ever had to turn the power up to a max of four. On the Rottweiler mix, I had to turn it up to eight once to get her attention. Of course this device is meant to be used as a tool, and requires proper training with the dog. When used properly, it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten Barcenas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: My dog was small animal aggressive and unsure of my commands.Her behavior changed immediately. She responded to commands and discontinued barking and attacking small animals. The device was simple to operate. The problems I had with this training tool were its long charging period and the short life of the charge. Also the contact points on this tool are threaded in. One of the prongs worked its way out. I am currently looking for a replacement, otherwise I will have to purchase a new collar.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Works great. However
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However, I don't recommend buying this unless you know how to train a dog. This is not to be used as a torture device because you get angry at your dog. The point is NOT to use the shock but only to use the warning beep. It's learned behavior, but humans need to be trained first.
customer_reviews.author: PixRvw

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this. My puppy is really stubborn and even though we know yelling isn't the best way to handle a dog that's what it all boiled down to and he just stopped listening. Literally one shock was all it took - he knows exactly what not to do now. Sometimes he tries his luck but we usually don't have to use more than the warning beep. The only thing is it seems to die really fast, and usually right around when we would need to actually shock him again, but it works really well nonetheless. I'm thinking of buying another so I don't have to worry about the dog running rampant while the collar charges.
customer_reviews.author: DameEdna

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Works great and has really helped curve some of my pets nasty habits. But you have to watch them and catch them in the act. Only complaint I have is battery life and how long it takes to charge it back up. That’s why I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Collar length great for big dog
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I set it on lowest setting and my German Shepherd responded quickly. Took 24 hrs for initial charge then only 12 hrs after. Collar is large and I had no problem fitting it on my 110lb Shepherd....about 4-5 inches left over.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool , If you have trained your dog
customer_reviews.text: Hiking or just walking around the block theses are great, word of warning you still need to train your dog this is a tool for your dog not magic, I have three dogs and all three are TRAINED to walk on an remote lead , but they all were trained on lead first , please train your dog first then advance to this device it is not going to work unless your dog knows leash corrections
customer_reviews.author: jt22

customer_reviews.title: Makes a huge difference with our coonhound. Her behavior ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes a huge difference with our coonhound. Her behavior has improved greatly, and I only had to use a low shock a couple times. Now all I ever have to use is the sound, if anything. She usually just responds, because she has it on. We have used it for several months, without complaint. She has only run once since getting it, and there was no stopping her, no matter the shock strength. She hasn't done it since, however. I attribute part of that to the nature of her breed.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie F

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few weeks - then stopped
customer_reviews.text: Everything was working great and after about 5 weeks the collar/remote just quit working together. We called manufacturer's customer service and they instructed for a 'reboot' but it did not help. Currently trying to exchange, but Amazon info says it is a week too late! If I can exchange for another one that works will be happy and go with 5 stars -but if not, will be very unhappy about the money and time wasted and will go with 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda Zelesnikar

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought for our pup
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought for our pup. It has helped him learn to stay out of the gardens, off of the couch, and not to chew on anything but his toys. We have only had to use the stimulation of 2 for him a couple of times. He gets the sound warning and stops immediately. This takes away the conflict between doggy parents and our canine kids and puts it squarely on the behavior that needs to be corrected. A simple no without all the frustration of your doggy ignoring you. It has helped us train our pup to be a wonderful family member.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have made this purchase sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17lb toy fox terrier mix. She was B-A-D. I even hired a trainer to come to the house with no luck. This works like a charm! Best $100+ bucks I ever spent. I only use it on the #1 setting, but even now just putting her collar on prevents her from acting up. She walks well, barks less and does not chase cars or attack other animals and/or people. I wish I would have bought this sooner. I felt really bad using it the first few times but she learned very fast and now I only have to use the warning signal.
customer_reviews.author: Christin J.

customer_reviews.title: PetSafe Yard & Park Rechargeable Dog Training Collar with Tone and Static Correction
customer_reviews.text: One of the better brands on the market to train a pet and stop bad behavior. This one is good and with all its settings, makes it simple to go up or down on levels, from beeps to shocks. Only issue is short batter life and 8-10 hours to fully charge it.
customer_reviews.author: William Gunter

customer_reviews.title: These have helped make them better listeners despite natural preying behavior of other animals in ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these (have 2, one for each dog) on our 100 lbs. a piece German Shepherds. The younger dog only usually needs a tone to get behavior in check. The 8 yr. old sometimes needs a little stim to stop barking at other dogs or remind him of proper neighborhood manners. He has a much thicker coat and tends not to feel it and doesn't seem to hear the tone anymore, likely due to age and hearing loss. These have helped make them better listeners despite natural preying behavior of other animals in the environment. There has been no ill effects or resentments on their part.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard, Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great at first. We are 6 weeks in and it will no longer hold a charge or charge all the way to green. I have contacted the company to return. But their return policy says 45 days so we ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Jcraze0114

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for Quickly Ending Bad/Dangerous Behavior
customer_reviews.text: Instead of buying an underground fence with all the lines to be buried and the flags to plant on our 2 acres, we bought this remote control collar to quickly train our puppy (8 month old) from running out into the road (we have 2 main roads intersecting at the corner of our house). After one shock on setting #2 he avoids the roads. He followed my car up the driveway one day, and my husband had only to use the warning beep to turn him back to the house. I don't normally like the idea of shocking our pets, but we had tried lots of other training techniques, and they didn't work. He won't go near the roads now.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Harvey

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Have not had this very long and it's already broke. This is our SECOND ONE. We only use the BEEP on it not the SHOCK. This one the BEEP was sooooo low when we got it the dog couldn't hear the beep. :(. Very upset this product didn't turn out to last and be as effective as our first one that lasted two years. This one didn't last two months!
customer_reviews.author: mainlyme

customer_reviews.title: The positive and negative reinforcement sounds are great. Before he gets the stimulation
customer_reviews.text: My pup is 6 months old and he has a problem with taking off when I tell him to come. I've only used this product less than a week and there is already a drastic improvement. The positive and negative reinforcement sounds are great. Before he gets the stimulation, I warn him with the negative tones and he usually responds to that alone; immediately. He is a very stubborn breed, but this collar has helped immensely in his training. I was skeptical of these collars, but now I will definitely recommend to anyone. The quick shipment of the device was very much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Age

customer_reviews.title: Finally a quality training collar!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd collar I purchased this year. The other 2 were Chinese junk. This was the mid priced of the three. Hands down this is the best one. As soon as you take it out of the package you will see and feel the quality. Feels solid and incredibly well built. My dog has been through the swamp and pond many times now and the collar still works fine. The range is great. Works even when he is out of sight. My other 2 collars cost $55 & $150 so I think this was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: aaron c oquist

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these collars I’ve purchased in the last 5 years for various dogs.... this one however I’ve had for 4 months and the shock function already is not working. Very disappointed and will be sadly looking for a new brand now
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Serious collar!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is serious. I have a German Shepherd and a lab mix. Neither one of them can defeat this thing. You would have to have a dog with a very high titration (they used that in the military-means threshold to them, don't know why) level. All joking aside, this thing is not a toy. It can do some serious mental damage to a weak dog. Simply put; if you are not familiar with principles of conditioning, you should be before you use this. Otherwise, in my opinion, this tool could easily be turned into dog abuse. Other than that, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It work great. I used it to train him to not kill my chickens. Now he can roam the ranch with all the animals with out the collar. The collar did its job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New to this trainer...so far, so good! How to use with 2 dogs?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product after observing how well it works when my son trains his 70 pound lab. Placed the collar on our 9 pound yorkie to stop barking. After one correction at level 1 stimulation, no more barking if the collars on him. Simply use the command quiet when a stimulus arises and he is quiet. Then tried it on a 15 pound miniature poodle. It took several rounds of level 1 stimulation and negative tone, but worked in one session. I'd like to get the add-a-collar, but haven't been able to determine if the tones and stimulation can be directed to only one dog at a time. Anyone have experience using this on two dogs? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: anita dahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Won't hold charge. I want a refund!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After less than a year, the receiver would no longer hold a charge. I WANT A REFUND for the 2 that I bought. OLD REVIEW: The batteries actually last over a day. I think the collar turns off after 24 hours or so, but the instructions say not to leave them on the dogs longer than 12 hours anyways. I rarely charge the remotes, not sure how long they last. Had to shock one dog on level 6 when he ran out into the road (tried 2 & 4 first). He listens to me now even without the collar.
customer_reviews.author: Agathon

customer_reviews.title: A great investment for our dog (Bradley is 5 Rottweiler
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in '14, just now looking to get a replacement battery with fairly regular use. A great investment for our dog (Bradley is 5 Rottweiler, German Shepard, Lab mix 85lbs). Use it right and you wont even have to "shock" your dog. The highest setting ive ever had to use 3 barely even gives my fingers a tingle when ive tried it. The "good" and "bad" tone are great for training from tricks to walking off the leash in the woods. Used to hold a great charge, could be on for easily a full day or more if accidentally left on.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: We live in the hills of West Virginia and I have a wild little collie mix who loves to chase chickens and deer this has helped so much to keep him out of trouble with the neighbors and to let him know the chickens are not "toys". Level 8 is really strong we usually stay on level 4 just because he has thick fur. He is now understanding that the negative tone means no so we aren't having to shock him as much. This remote and collar are built tough I love that both the collar and remote are rechargeable and that the collar can be turned off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: A great price, and a great product. I bought this to help train my German Shorthair Pointer puppy, and it turned out to be a godsend. It has 8 different levels of shock (tried them out on myself first, and honestly, number 8 has a bit of a bite to it), but nothing that would "hurt" the animal. I love the fact that this unit has the positive tone as well as a negative tone. Most of the time, i can just hit the negative tone and my dog will instantly stop what she was doing wrong. The positive tone seems to work more for her as a "come here" button, but works well just the same. Highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: JConn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use and batteries last quite a while before recharging (maybe 12 hours before it weakens). I use it with my german shepherd when we go for nature hikes. The lower shock setting is all I use; it's more of a minor annoyance, like getting a static shock from folding sheets. She's trained to come to me when I beep her collar, so there's no more yelling her name until she decides to return. UPDATE 8/29/18 Collar lasted for a couple years before the rechargeable batteries died. I still love the collar; it charged fast and kept a long charge until the day it died.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: This is the best training, bark
customer_reviews.text: This is the best training, bark, or behavior collar on the market. This is our second one. We have a very energetic golden retriever that has anxiety, so this collar is a must. Our first one lasted about 2 years. We didn't push the rubber piece that protects the battery in all the way and when our dog went swimming it shorted. We tried two Two collars that were cheaper and they didn't do the job. Finally came back and I am so happy we did. The good and bad times are basically all we use and they are quite effective. Occasionally we will use the shock but being able to adjust the strength is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed With Product
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed when this was received. Couldn't get it to charge; the handheld remote had chew marks on it and some of the metal had rust on it. I thought I had ordered a new product, but evidently it was refurbished and not too well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This collar is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have an 90 lb pit bull. My wife and I rescued when he was around a year old. He is a maniac but very sweet. Its hard for my wife to control him because hes so strong and will not listen. We could never keep him from running off. I used this collar on a low setting (3) just to get his attention when he won't listen. Within 72 hours he was a different dog! Now I only use the audible beep. This collar is a life savor! I have had it for over a year and it still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: While it works great and corrects my dog's behavior
customer_reviews.text: While it works great and corrects my dog's behavior, I find that I have to charge it every day. A longer battery life would be nice. :-/
customer_reviews.author: RT Deb

customer_reviews.title: I have to return it as it is not useful to me at all
customer_reviews.text: Not stated on product page but you cannot use a metallic collar in addition. If I could handle my 85-lb dog without her pinch collar, I wouldn't need the remote trainer. Sadly, I have to return it as it is not useful to me at all. No problems with ordering, no problems with seller. Perhaps an important fact about the non-metallic collar should be posted on the product page.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J.

customer_reviews.title: These are discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: Beware! These are discontinued and there are no accesories available for them. Also, I am told that unless you purchase them from an authorized dealer then there is no warranty.
customer_reviews.author: piper235

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: We tried this collar set in hopes it would stop a large puppy. The settings were not strong enough to slow down a 60lb pup. We tried three brands and I wish I listened to the reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: We have had this collar for over a year now. We have to charge it up every 2 or 3 days, because we keep it on our dog all the time. We use the shock feature seldom, mostly in the middle of the night, to keep her from barking on and on and on... It works right away, and she learns not to bark as much. We use the "beep" feature to call the dog when she's outside and we don't know where. Make sure the contacts are screwed on tight. We lost one and had to order a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Engineer Appraiser

customer_reviews.title: Buy one and watch your dog fall in love with a beautiful life of clear an concise correction ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering this product it's because your dog resembles a coyote mixed with a wild pony instead of a dog. Buy one and watch your dog fall in love with a beautiful life of clear and concise correction free of anger and frustration. Green training was NOT working for my sweet beautiful baby girl.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for behavioral issues
customer_reviews.text: We use this to teach our 90 lb. lab behavior, especially not to jump on people. The beep works well and we’ve not had to use the shock button so far. He reacts very positively to the beep sound.
customer_reviews.author: Patches

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This works best using a short pulse at setting 3 or 4 (out of 8). This is also a setting I am comfortable using on myself under continuous. This is the second unit I have purchased. The first one came with a handy strap to hang the remote around my neck. The newest one came with a useless wrist strap. The reason for replacing it is that the rechargeable battery stopped working after 6 months. Emails to PetSafe customer service went unanswered. I am giving this four stars for its performance before battery issues, and the reliability of other PetSafe products I continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: HumaHumaNukaNukaApuaA

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is really simple to use.. warning... it is not for great hiking if they don't stay by or close to you. Get one that has a longer range. This a great tool to train your dog with. I did test on myself first.. 1-3 are great for warning.. 4 will get your attention and theirs. After using if for a couple of months we no longer need to use it. Read the booklet ...is a must to use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy  Cobb

customer_reviews.title: This training collar has taken care of a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: This training collar has taken care of a number of problems I've been having with dog . I use the sound buttons more then the shock, that is used only if he tries to run out of the yard . So far I've used the shock only 3 times since I've had it and only on #5 setting and only on a setting I've tried on myself first .I feel that is only fair to the dog . I've had this collar for about a month now and my dog is about 70 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Pavlov had it right
customer_reviews.text: Good points: it's better than the other training collar we were using. It is easy to charge. The beep is loud. Zap is strong. The box on the collar is independent of the collar. (The Little dog trainer by PetSafe, has a component attached to the collar that detaches, rendering it useless). Bad points: no belt clip on remote. The zapper is super strong, so I can't set it over '2'. The box on the collar is really large. (It bothered me more than the dog. He didn't care.)
customer_reviews.author: FowlWinds

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid
customer_reviews.text: It didn't take long for my dog to recognize the warning beep, so now I just need to press that button for her to listen. There are some instances where I need to use the shock (vibration really since I only use setting 1), but since I've only had my dog for 2 months and this collar for a month that's to be expected. Either way, the beeping and light vibration/shock gets my dog's attention and keeps her from pulling on the leash, jumping on strangers, and chasing squirrels/birds/dogs.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Workes very well
customer_reviews.text: It took our dog few minor shocks to start behaving again. We have GS, she became aggressive towards other dog sin the park. We trained her with a key phrase and a shock, no longer needed after less then week.
customer_reviews.author: Amnon Feiner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, and after charging it for a day, I tried it out on myself before we put it on our dog. I like how there is a positive and negative sound that she clearly notices the difference to. Level 1 is next to nothing. I could barely feel it...might phase an ant, but not a 45 lbs Lab. Level 2 is a good attention grabber. Level 3 makes her jump, but since I did it to my self first...it isn't that bad at all. Good range, and the battery lasts all day. We take it off and charge at night while sleeping. I LOVE not worrying about batteries, or wondering if they are even working. Great product...very pleased here.
customer_reviews.author: Diver Dave

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great... when it worked. Issues with staying turned on throughout the day, now trouble getting it to hold a charge at all. Really bummed. Hope we can get our money back. FOLLOW UP: Just spoke to the manufacturer and learned that this device was discontinued back in the summer. I bought it from this Amazon distributor in September. Don't be fooled by this distributor... there is reason they stopped making this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good collar
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for the last one we had. Works pretty good with our dog, an Ambull. Since it is a discontinued item, got it for half the price of the original.
customer_reviews.author: DGeo

customer_reviews.title: Effective.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shock collar for my 95lbs pit bull. He kept sneaking out the garage while we where sleeping. Since purchasing Rosé has improved behaviorally. It’s a little harsh, was against it at first but now it’s cool. I don’t always have to shock him. Making the “zit” sound gets his attention. The product itself has a decent charge length Just takes time to charge and water resistant for sure, I just wouldn’t keep it submerged.
customer_reviews.author: Ladasia

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof and programmable. An excellent tool for the professional trainer. The audible feature is particularly valuable once the dog has been conditioned with low voltage. NEVER necessary to go beyond the 4 setting (possibly 5 if dog has a very thick coat) Collar may not fit very small dogs as it is designed for field trial work. If you are not a trainer, use this with a professional before using on your own. Absolute best value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine A

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful tool. I use it on my Catahoula and Pitt puppies. They are just about 1yo and they are easily distracted at such a young age. The Catahoula is appx 75lbs and the Pitt is right around 65lbs, so it is very useful on even its lowest settings to "get their attention." It didn't take them long at all to figure out that if they here the beep to stop what they were doing and get back in line because it will be followed by a mild "zap" if they choose to ignore it. Recommend it for the price and its function.
customer_reviews.author: Zookeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: We had a German Sheppard puppy that wanted to eat my cat! We broke her from it with this! My husband only had to shock her on low about three times. After that the beep was all that was required and she now leaves my cat alone. So I no longer have to worry about her trying to kill my cat. She just stays away from him. Also if you want your dog to learn yard boundaries so they don't run off then it is beneficial for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This collar has worked wonders for my golden doodle. I have used it to train him to stay in bounds at the park. My wife has tested the shock and she says that it is not bad. We usually have it on a low setting and it is just enough to get him to pay attention but not get hurt. If you are hesitant to use the shock, the negative sound works great too. It even worked for our 70 non-listening golden doodle. If you are in search for the perfect collar, this is it. It is worth the price when your dog will finally listen!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Charge doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Charge only lasts a day at most and recharge takes about 8 hours. I am very disappointed in this product and do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Setlikeflint

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this, I thought one of the buttons had stopped working. They actually all wor fine.. I had the settings changed and didn't realize it. Read all of the user instrusctions! Great quality product! I have had this about a year or more now and it's still works fantastic. I hardley have to use it anymore though, because my dog listens great now. I definitely recommend this product, for training purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: The warning beeps are terrible. Not only does the dog keep barking but you have an annoying beep to go along with it. Then the vibrations stopped working after 45 days of use. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Juan J. Caban

customer_reviews.title: May not last
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a few months and then started acting up. Got an educator instead and it's worked really well for a year.
customer_reviews.author: PGS

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective, my dog actually listens now!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have ever done for my dog hands down. I can't tell you how much happier she is, and my family is in words. There is a sense of peace having this training tool that wasn't there before. She's now a perfectly well behaved dog that I could not train into her before. I can't evaluate this collar as being better than any other since this is the first training collar I've ever had/used. If you are going to get this for your dog please do so responsibly. This shock is no joke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even turning it to full blast, our 8 month old German Shephard didn't even flinge.
customer_reviews.text: She didn't even aknowledg she was zapped, so how can this be anygood???? Sizeable amount of money spent for nothing!!!! Sigh, so very disappointed, I thought this may work to make her stop chasing our cats.
customer_reviews.author: Eyes wide openTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent training tool
customer_reviews.text: When used properly, this is an excellent training tool! My once chicken killing bullmastiff is now a non chicken chasing boy. I can relax about the fact that my dog won't be killing anymore of our chickens! I also used this to stop the above mentioned bullmastiff from going over to the neighbors to say "hi". We have 5.5 acres so plenty of space for him to run. He just likes going over when the neighbors are out. The neighbors don't mind but I do. With just a couple short training sessions, his habit of saying "hi" to the neighbors has completely stopped!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is pretty good at first. My main complaint is the battery life. When I first got it, the range was good and it worked very well for training my dog. But after a few months of daily use and charging, the range has significantly decreased. Even after getting a full charge, the range is only good at about 30 feet. My dog is starting to learn that he only has to obey my commands to drop that little dead rotting animal he picked up if he is close enough to get shocked. He knows he can eat that nasty thing if he gets far enough away.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This model is more pricey - but it works like a charm. I've bought two units (have had 1 unit almost 3 years) - both still working. The charge only last a couple days, but I'm in the habit of recharging every other day and that works for me. I question the 400 yard range --- but I do live in a wooded area which is probably why I don't get a very clear signal for long ranges. All in all - a great unit and well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: ATLBuckeyeGirl

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: I have had this collar for about 6 years and it finally just died. I will be buying another one. I dont even need to use it because my dog knows when it is on and he listens so much better
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Goulding

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It’s helping my dog so much. But the thing is it’s no vibration in it. Just tones and shock.
customer_reviews.author: Kymmie

customer_reviews.title: but we don't use it as much as we would like to based on the previously mentioned frustrations
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is somewhat suspect...takes hours on hours to charge, and then will last a decent bit (maybe 24 hours on). Also, it was hard to properly fit on my german shepherd, as it would inconsistently work (i.e. shock sometimes, but minutes later it would not due to how thick her hair was). Overall, the product did help train her, but we don't use it as much as we would like to based on the previously mentioned frustrations.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wears

product_meta.title: PetSafe Yard & Park Rechargeable Dog Training Collar with Tone and Static Correction, Waterproof, Up to 400 Yards
product_meta.description: The PetSafe Yard & Park Trainer makes it easy to train multiple dogs at the same time using the same remote. Add up to 2 collars, one for each dog, for a total of 3 dogs per system. You can also use it as a replacement collar for your one-dog system. With a range of up to 800 yards away, this trainer lets you train your dog even when he’s not wearing a leash. Teach your dog new obedience commands or teach him not to misbehave. The unit has 8 levels of static correction and a lightweight collar that can fit any dog comfortably. The rechargeable remote and collar mean no batteries to buy. Stop jumping, pulling, digging and other annoying behaviors. For dogs 8 pounds and up. Range up to 800 yards. 8 adjustable levels of static correction. Tone-only mode alerts your pet with a beep. Waterproof collar submersible up to 5 feet. Rechargeable battery (built-in; replaceable.) If you’re not sure which training product to choose, contact our Customer Care team Monday through Saturday and we'll gladly help you decide. If this product is not meeting your needs, please contact PetSafe Brand. PetSafe brand has been an industry leading US manufacturer of pet behavior, containment and lifestyle products since 1991, helping millions of people and pets each year. Call, chat or email the PetSafe US-based customer care specialists six days a week. Measures 2 3/8 inch wide x 1 3/8 inch tall x 1 ½ inch thick,Weighs 2.8 Pounds with strap & battery .
feature_bullets: 400 YARD RANGE - flexible enough to work for indoor training or for outdoor hiking with your dog
8 ADJUSTABLE LEVELS - static stimulation and 2 tones level to teach commands and correct behavior
WATERPROOF COLLAR - for all of your dog's outdoor activities
RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES - collar and remote use replaceable rechargeable batteries
TRAIN UP TO THREE DOGS AT THE SAME TIME - with additional collars sold separately PAC00-12159
FITS DOGS OVER 8 lb. - good for dogs of all sizes; Fits neck sizes up to 28"
Call, chat or email with our expert PetSafe US-based customer care specialists six days a week; They are waiting to assist you and your pet with your product needs
Manufacturer’s warranty is only valid when purchased from an authorized retailer

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
